content: I have a few years of experience with react, nodejs, sql and ruby (mostly rails apps). I've been interested in rust for a while and am ready to go beyond the online playground. From everything i've seen so far, rust has a great community!
Welcome! What sort of thing are you interested in working on?

i'm not 100% set on anything yet. I would like to get to know the language a little more and see what I could do with it. What interested me in the first place was the performance benefits and that rust is a 'memory safe' language. I've been obsessed with xmr and Tor the past year and would most likely use rust to develop a tool in that realm

Tor itself has some rust code, but it's not being actively developed:
https://github.com/torproject/tor/tree/master/src/rust

I'm one of the people working on Zebra, which is a Rust Zcash node.

We've just started adding support for anonymous transaction relaying using Tor - maybe a similar design would work for Monero?

Draft design:
https://github.com/ZcashFoundation/zebra/pull/1006

Prototype implementation:
https://github.com/ZcashFoundation/zebra/pull/1008
